intro: Psychotria alaotrensis, commonly known as the Madagascar Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in local ecosystems. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
